text: The Atlantic Soccer Conference Tournament was the conference championship tournament in men's soccer for the Atlantic Soccer Conference. The tournament was held annually between 2006 and 2011. The conference disbanded when its membership dwindled to three members. == Champions == === Key === {| class="wikitable" |- | (2) | Title number |- |style="background- color:#FBCEB1"|* |Match went to extra time |- |style="background- color:#cedff2"|† |Match decided by a penalty shootout after extra time |- |Bold |Regular season champion |- |Bold italic |Regular season co-champion |} === Finals === {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Champion !Score !Runner-up !Venue !Tournament MVP |- | 2006 || Adelphi |align="center"| 3–2 | Florida Atlantic | Motamed Field • Garden City, New York | Ron Foreman, Adelphi |- | 2007 || Florida Atlantic |align="center" style="background-color:#cedff2"| 1–1† | Longwood | LU Athletics Complex • Farmville, Virginia | Phillip Lamarre, FAU |- | 2008 || Longwood |align="center"| 1–0 | Adelphi | LU Athletics Complex • Farmville, Virginia | Martin Vickerton, Longwood |- | 2009 || Adelphi |align="center"| 2–1 | Longwood | LU Athletics Complex • Farmville, Virginia | Issa Tall, Adelphi |- | 2010 || Adelphi |align="center" style="background- color:#FBCEB1"| 2–1* | Houston Baptist | Motamed Field • Garden City, New York | Dan Larenius, Adelphi |- | 2011 || Longwood |align="center" style="background-color:#cedff2"|0–0† | Adelphi | Motamed Field • Garden City, New York | Joel Helmick, Longwood |- |} ==References== Tournament Atlantic Soccer
